explanation.rules:
Word Order: OSV (Object, Subject, Verb) and NA (Noun, Adjective).  

Transformations:
•        A → V (‘make A’): A-man.
V → A:
•        V |‘that is always being Ved’| ‘that is always Ving Ns’
•        -n | -l-muŋa  | N-…-l- ŋay-muŋa
•        - ɲu |  -y-muŋa  | N-…-nay-muŋa

 Every noun is preceded by an article: O | S:
•        balan | baŋgun | women, dangerous animals, and objects.
•        bayi | baŋgul |  men, animals.
•        bala | baŋgu | all other things. 

Subject and Attributes Endings:
•        -ŋgu if word ends in a vowel and has two syllables.
•        -gu if word ends in a vowel and has more than two syllables.
•        -Du if word ends in a consonant (D is a stop articulated in the same place in the mouth as the final sound of the word).
